description: This seminar focuses on examining data from Penn's Jerry Lee Program of Randomized Controlled Trials in Restorative Justice, the largest program of field experiments in the history of criminology. Key questions to be answered by the research program include the effects of restorative conferences on the future crime rates of offenders and victims, on the mental health and medical condition of both, and on the changes over time in these dimensions of the life course of both victims and offenders.
name: Research Seminar on Experiments in Restorative Justice

section.name: Research Seminar on Experiments in Restorative Justice
